gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Use this exercise to prepare for important conversations where you need to maintain self-respect. Work through each element of FAST to build confidence and clarity before you speak.

inputs.label: What situation requires you to use FAST?
inputs.placeholder: Describe the situation where you need to maintain self-respect...

inputs.label: What is your specific request or boundary?
inputs.placeholder: What do you need to ask for or what boundary do you need to set?

subsections.title: Fair
subsections.label: Fair - Is your request fair to both you and the other person?
subsections.placeholder: How is this request fair? What makes it reasonable for both parties?

subsections.title: Apologies
subsections.label: Apologies - Are you avoiding unnecessary apologies?
subsections.placeholder: What unnecessary apologies might you be tempted to make? How will you avoid them?

subsections.title: Stick to Values
subsections.label: Stick to Values - How does this align with your core values?
subsections.placeholder: What values are you honoring by making this request? Why is this important to you?

subsections.title: Truthful
subsections.label: Truthful - Are you being honest about your needs and feelings?
subsections.placeholder: What is the honest truth about what you need? Are you being authentic?

inputs.label: How confident do you feel about this conversation? (1-10)
inputs.placeholder: Rate your confidence and explain. What would help you feel more confident?

inputs.label: Final planning notes
inputs.placeholder: What key points will you remember? How will you stay grounded in your values during the conversation?
